newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Miners strike at Portuguese copper mine.
newsitem.headline: Miners strike at Portuguese copper mine.

text.p: Several hundred miners at Europe's largest copper mine began an indefinite strike Monday over working hours, company and labour officials said.
A spokesman for Somincor, the state-owned company that operates the Neves Corvo mine, said that output was expected to drop to about 20 percent of usual as a result of the action.
However, according to local radio reports, striking workers were blocking access to the mine near Beja, some 150 miles southeast of Lisbon, raising the question of whether any work would be possible.
The mine, which employs some 500 miners, produced 107,000 metric tons of copper in 1996. It also produces small quantities of tin.

The workers are angry at the company's plans to introduce seven-day shifts. The company says falling copper yields mean more intensive working of the mine is necessary to ensure that it can compete with other international producers.
